subject: Mental Health
title: The Prefrontal Cortex Goes Dark
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Prefrontal Cortex Goes Dark.

hook.text: The part of your brain responsible for reason literally shuts down during trauma.

buildup.text: The prefrontal cortex handles logic, planning, and impulse control.

discovery.text: Under extreme threat, blood flow shifts away from it toward survival circuits.

twist.text: This is why survivors can't just think their way out of a flashback.

climax.text: Brain scans of PTSD patients show reduced prefrontal activity during triggers.

punchline.text: You can't reason with a brain in survival mode.

quiz.question: What happens to the prefrontal cortex during trauma?
options: Blood flow shifts away, reducing its activity
